co.poynt.os.services.v1

Interface IPoyntSecondScreenService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    android.os.IInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IPoyntSecondScreenService.Stub

    public interface IPoyntSecondScreenService
extends android.os.IInterface
    Provides the interfaces to request display of various predefined second screen consumer UI templates. When the templates allow the consumers to enter information, the callbacks are used to return the customer entered information to the caller applications. All calls require the necessary permissions declared in the caller's Android Manifest file. Please refer to Poynt OS Permissions for more details.
    Since:
    1.0-beta2

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IPoyntSecondScreenService.Stub
      Local-side IPC implementation stub class.

    • Method Detail

      • showItem

        void showItem(java.util.List<co.poynt.api.model.OrderItem> items,
              long totalAmount,
              java.lang.String currency)
       throws android.os.RemoteException
        Displays the given list of items on the second screen. Only the last 3 items are displayed at any given time along with the item count and total amount.
        Parameters:
        items - List of OrderItems to display
        totalAmount - Total amount of items in cents.
        currency - Currency of the total amount.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • displayWelcome

        void displayWelcome(java.lang.String buttonLabel,
                    android.graphics.Bitmap topLogo,
                    IPoyntSecondScreenCheckInListener listener)
             throws android.os.RemoteException
        Displays the welcome screen to the customer with an optional Check-in button. Button width is 80dp and height wraps content
        Parameters:
        buttonLabel - The label displayed on the button (defaults to "CHECK-IN")
        topLogo - logo to display above the button label
        callback - (@link IPoyntSecondScreenCheckInListener}
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

               long totalAmount,
               java.lang.String currency)
        throws android.os.RemoteException
        Displays the given order on the second screen. Only the last 3 items are displayed at any given time along with the item count and total amount,discount applied,tax exempted.
        Parameters:
        order - order Orders to display
        totalAmount - Total amount of items in cents.
        currency - Currency of the total amount.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • captureEmailAddress

        void captureEmailAddress(java.lang.String currentReceiptEmail,
                         SecondScreenLabels negativeButtonLabel,
                         SecondScreenLabels positiveButtonLabel,
                         IPoyntSecondScreenEmailEntryListener listener)
                  throws android.os.RemoteException
        Displays the email address collection screen to the customer.
        Parameters:
        currentReceiptEmail - customer's email on record (if available)
        negativeButtonLabel - optional parameter to select a label for the button which defaults to "CANCEL"
        positiveButtonLabel - optional parameter to select a label for the button which defaults to "SEND"
        callback - IPoyntSecondScreenEmailEntryListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • collectRating

        void collectRating(int minValue,
                   int maxValue,
                   int increment,
                   java.lang.String message,
                   android.graphics.Bitmap logo,
                   android.graphics.Bitmap scaleImage,
                   IPoyntSecondScreenRatingEntryListener listener)
            throws android.os.RemoteException
        Collect rating from the user based on the given scale.
        Parameters:
        minValue - minimum value of the scale (eg. 1)
        maxValue - maximum value of the scale (eg. 5)
        increment - by between min and max values (eg. value of 1 will display rating scale as 1 2 3 4 5)
        listener - IPoyntSecondScreenRatingEntryListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • showCheckIn

        void showCheckIn(java.lang.String buttonLabel,
                 android.graphics.Bitmap buttonBackground,
                 android.graphics.Bitmap backgroundImage,
                 IPoyntSecondScreenCheckInListener listener)
          throws android.os.RemoteException
        Displays a screen with an action button with the default text "CHECK-IN"
        Parameters:
        buttonLabel - text of the button. If null is passed, the default "CHECK-IN" is displayed
        buttonBackground - background image for the button (800dp x 80dp). If null, the button has a default blue color. If not null, the button background is set to transparent color
        backgroundImage - background for the second screen (800dp x 480dp). If null, the default background is used.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • capturePhoneWithOptions

        void capturePhoneWithOptions(java.lang.String currentPhone,
                             SecondScreenLabels negativeButtonLabel,
                             SecondScreenLabels positiveButtonLabel,
                             android.os.Bundle options,
                             IPoyntSecondScreenPhoneEntryListener listener)
                      throws android.os.RemoteException
        Displays the phone numer collection screen to the customer.
        Parameters:
        currentPhone - customer's phone number on record (if available)
        negativeButtonLabel - optional parameter to select a label for the button which defaults to "CANCEL"
        positiveButtonLabel - optional parameter to select a label for the button which defaults to "ENTER"
        options - bundle to pass additional confirmation arguments. Support keys: PROMPT - text prompt in the phone field. Default "ENTER PHONE NUMBER". Allowed values are defined in SecondScreenStrings
        callback - IPoyntSecondScreenPhoneEntryListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • captureCashback

        void captureCashback(long amount,
                     long tipAmount,
                     long cashbackAmountLimit,
                     java.lang.String currency,
                     boolean autoSubmit,
                     long autoSubmitTimeout,
                     IPoyntSecondScreenCashbackEntryListener listener)
              throws android.os.RemoteException
        Displays the cashback collection screen to the customer.
        Parameters:
        amount - of the transaction (without cashback)
        tip - amount (in addition to the amount)
        cashbackAmountLimit - max cashback allowed
        currency -
        autoSubmit - apply timeout on the cashback collection screen
        autoSubmitTimeout - timeout in millisecs
        listener - IPoyntSecondScreenCashbackEntryListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
